ext_weather.name: This Afternoon
ext_weather.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West wind 10 to 15 mph.

space_weather:
Space Weather Message Code: ALTTP4
Serial Number: 562
Issue Time: 2022 Feb 12 0936 UTC

ALERT: Type IV Radio Emission
Begin Time: 2022 Feb 12 0847 UTC

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Description: Type IV emissions occur in association with major eruptions on the sun and are typically associated with strong coronal mass ejections and solar radiation storms.

Space Weather Message Code: ALTTP2
Serial Number: 1114
Issue Time: 2022 Feb 12 0849 UTC

ALERT: Type II Radio Emission
Begin Time: 2022 Feb 12 0833 UTC
Estimated Velocity: 642 km/s

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Description: Type II emissions occur in association with eruptions on the sun and typically indicate a coronal mass ejection is associated with a flare event.

Space Weather Message Code: WARK04
Serial Number: 4030
Issue Time: 2022 Feb 12 0555 UTC

EXTENDED WARNING: Geomagnetic K-index of 4 expected
Extension to Serial Number: 4029
Valid From: 2022 Feb 10 1400 UTC
Now Valid Until: 2022 Feb 12 1200 UTC
Warning Condition: Persistence

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Potential Impacts: Area of impact primarily poleward of 65 degrees Geomagnetic Latitude.
Induced Currents - Weak power grid fluctuations can occur.
Aurora - Aurora may be visible at high latitudes such as Canada and Alaska.
